item.title: Hyperpop: When Underground Internet Music Goes Mainstream
item.description: Charli XCX’s club-centric record, “Brat”, brought Hyperpop to the forefront of music, and, with more music coming this fall, what exactly is it?
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: Why We Can’t Get Enough of Sabrina Carpenter’s New Album “Short n’ Sweet”
item.description: Sabrina Carpenter’s long-awaited album, “Short n’ Sweet” is finally here, and it’s already a modern pop classic.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: All The Best Shows at Swim Week Las Vegas
item.description: Orchestrated by Art Hearts Fashion, over 20 designers showed and Macy Gray performed.
item.author: Angela Li

item.title: Rupal Banerjee On Personal Growth Through Design, And The Rise Of Fashion Label Ru By Rupal
item.description: The rising designer talks work and heritage behind the glowing success, and looks ahead to the brand's future.
item.author: Angela Li

item.title: Something Exciting is Coming August 21st!
item.description: Beyond The Pines Presents: The Factory
item.author: Angel Abad

item.title: 12 Totally “Brat” Songs From Britney Spears, Kim Petras, Slayyyter, And More
item.description: “Brat” summer is incomplete without these essential club tracks.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: 7 New Highly Anticipated Films Hitting Theaters in August 2024
item.description: Blake Lively stars in another whirlwind romance, while Bill Skarsgård and FKA Twigs are death-defying soulmates in a new dark fantasy.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: Ice Spice’s Latest Album, “Y2K!” In Review
item.description: With its anticipated arrival, Ice Spice’s debut album, “Y2K!,” struggles to find a sweet spot, and instead offers a look at how cultural impact can, especially in the age of a hyper-fast Internet, supersede music.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: Towa Bird Talks Queer Love And Creating a New “American Hero” For Her Debut Album
item.description: In an interview with Beyond The Pines, the rising guitarist and singer chats about tour shenanigans, writing over 100 songs, and putting lesbian representation at the forefront of her newly-released album.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: How The “MaXXXine” Costume Designer Mari-An Ceo Crafted The Film’s ‘80s Aesthetic
item.description: For Ti West’s final follow up to modern day horror sensations “X” and “Pearl,” lead costume designer Mari-An Ceo immerses viewers in nostalgia while avoiding cliches at all costs.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: Megan Thee Stallion: “MEGAN” Album Review
item.description: On Megan Thee Stallion’s eponymous third album, the self-dubbed H-Town Hottie’s lyrics brim with Southern limericks, heated affairs, rap beef, and the rapper’s ever-adored self-confidence.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: Model Alexis Ren Talks Starring in New Film "Latency," Welcoming Change, And Mental Health In The Digital Age
item.description: In conversation with BeyondThePines, Ren speaks openly about her segue into acting, launching a podcast, and more.
item.author: BTP

item.title: Inside The Shows At Milan And Paris Men's Fashion Week Spring/Summer 2025
item.description: Dries Van Noten exits his namesake fashion house, a debut from A$AP Rocky, and more.
item.author: Angela Li

item.title: Why Charli XCX's "Brat" Matters Now
item.description: “Brat,” is a bold album that reclaims The British pop star's reign, and redefines underground stardom in the present-day social media climate.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: Billie Eilish: “Hit Me Hard and Soft” Album Review
item.description: Billie Eilish’s new album opts for distinct creative choices that appear counter-intuitive to the moody, lip-pout experience the Grammy-winning singer-songwriter is known for.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: All The Celebs On The AmFAR Gala Red Carpet During The 2024 Cannes Film Festival
item.description: Beyond The Pines's Mat Abad captures the stars and fashion on the red carpet.
item.author: Sydney Goldhawk

item.title: The 8 Films Worth Seeing From The 2024 Cannes Film Festival Premieres
item.description: Barry Keoghan and Selena Gomez earned standing ovations for “Bird” and “Emelia Pèrez” respectively, while Anya Joy-Taylor wowed in the latest installment of George Miller’s beloved action-adventure blockbuster series.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: All The Best Red Carpet Fashion Moments From the 2024 Cannes Film Festival
item.description: Celebrities take to the 77th Annual Cannes Film Festival in their red carpet best, celebrating the premiere of films such as Yorgos Lanthimos’s “Kinds of Kindness” and “Furiosa,” the latest installment to the Mad Max saga.
item.author: Sydney Goldhawk

item.title: Director Jules Rosskam Explores The Trans Male Experience on Desire Lines
item.description: Jules Rosskam’s latest “hybrid” docufilm, Desire Lines, forms a thought-provoking discussion on the trans male experience using rediscovered oral histories, more contemporary interviews, and a fantasy bathhouse.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: Inside The Making Of Sabrina Harrison’s Met Gala Look
item.description: With just eight weeks to prepare, entrepreneur Sabrina Harrison enlisted the help of designer CHRISHABANA and stylists Law Roach and Carlos Alonso to make her Met Gala dreams come true.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: All The Best Celebrity Looks From the 2024 Met Gala Red Carpet
item.description: The gala’s theme “The Garden of Time” honored the Costume Institute's spring exhibition, “Sleeping Beauties: Reawakening Fashion.”

item.title: “Challengers” Review: Guadagnino Secures Zendaya’s Leading Role Victory in a Tennis Romance
item.description: Italian director Luca Guadagnino pulls career-best performances from Zendaya, Mike Faist, and Josh O’Connor, who are, together, entrapped in a decades-long love triangle.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: How Àlex Lora Cercós Injects Politics Into His Latest Short Film “The Masterpiece”

item.title: Director Tim Mielants On Navigating Grief, And Filming “Small Things Like These” With Cillian Murphy
item.description: Tim Mielants has undeniably scored another win with his melodramatic film-adaptation of the Claire Keegan novel, spotlighting a dark time in Irish history.
item.author: Andres Fabris

item.title: Dimitra Petsa On Her Celeb-Loved Wetlook Dress, And The Unsanitized Female Experience
item.description: The Grecian designer wants all women to celebrate their “wetness” with her emblematic Wetlook Dress, but there’s more the London-based designer wants to show the world.

item.title: Road to UEFA European Championship 2024: Brazil Clutches First Win at London Since 1995
item.description: 17-year-old Brazilian footballer Endrick puts a stop to England’s 21-game win streak, winning 1-0 in an international friendly at Wembley Stadium ahead of summer's European Championship tournament.
